title: RCB Wins IPL 2025 - Maiden Championship Trophy
description: Royal Challengers Bangalore finally lifted their first IPL trophy in 2025, defeating Mumbai Indians in a thrilling final at the Narendra Modi Stadium. After 17 years of heartbreak, RCB fans witnessed their team become champions. Glenn Maxwell's match-winning 68* off 33 balls and Faf du Plessis's captaincy led RCB to glory. The entire stadium erupted as Virat Kohli lifted the trophy alongside his teammates, tears of joy flowing after years of near-misses.

players.contribution: Player of the Match - 68* off 33 balls

stats.other: RCB scored 198/5, MI all out for 186

images.caption: Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli lift the IPL 2025 trophy together
RCB team celebrates their maiden IPL title
Virat Kohli emotional after winning first IPL title with RCB
Glenn Maxwell's match-winning knock in the final

title: Chris Gayle's 175* - Highest Individual Score in IPL History
description: The Universe Boss Chris Gayle smashed an unbeaten 175 off just 66 balls against Pune Warriors India in 2013, creating an IPL record that still stands today. This brutal innings included 13 fours and a staggering 17 sixes. Gayle reached his century in just 30 balls, the fastest in IPL history at that time. The M. Chinnaswamy Stadium witnessed carnage as Gayle single-handedly demolished the Pune bowling attack. RCB posted 263/5, the highest team total in IPL history, and won by 130 runs. This innings is considered one of the greatest T20 performances ever.

players.contribution: 175* off 66 balls - IPL's highest individual score

stats.other: Fastest century in 30 balls, RCB total 263/5 - highest IPL team score

images.caption: One of 17 sixes in the historic innings
Gayle raises his bat after reaching 150
RCB team congratulates Gayle after the innings

title: Virat Kohli & AB de Villiers 229-Run Partnership - IPL Record
description: On May 14, 2016, cricket fans witnessed one of the most destructive partnerships in T20 cricket history. Virat Kohli (109 off 55 balls) and AB de Villiers (129* off 52 balls) stitched together a mammoth 229-run partnership for the 2nd wicket against Gujarat Lions. This remains the highest partnership for any wicket in IPL history. The duo smashed 17 fours and 19 sixes combined, with a partnership strike rate of 238.54. RCB posted 248/3, and the partnership alone was more than most teams score in T20 cricket. The Chinnaswamy Stadium witnessed batting mastery as two of the greatest batsmen of their generation put on an absolute show.

stats.other: Highest partnership for any wicket in IPL history, RCB total 248/3

images.caption: Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers during their record 229-run partnership
The duo celebrates after the match
Iconic fist bump between Virat and AB during the partnership
Both batsmen reached their centuries in the same innings

title: Virat Kohli's Dream Season - 973 Runs in IPL 2016
description: In IPL 2016, Virat Kohli had the season of his life, scoring an unprecedented 973 runs in a single season - a record that still stands. He scored 4 centuries and 7 fifties, maintaining an average of 81.08 and a strike rate of 152.03. This included memorable knocks of 113, 108, 109, and 100*. Despite RCB not winning the title, Kohli's individual brilliance throughout the season was unmatched in IPL history.

players.contribution: 973 runs in IPL 2016 - Most runs in a single IPL season

images.caption: Virat Kohli with Orange Cap after record-breaking season
Kohli celebrates one of his four centuries in 2016

title: AB de Villiers' 31-Ball Century - Fastest in IPL
description: On May 14, 2015, AB de Villiers played one of the most destructive T20 innings ever seen. He scored 133* off just 59 balls against Mumbai Indians, including a century in just 31 balls - the fastest in IPL history. The innings featured 19 boundaries (4s and 6s) and showcased AB's 360-degree batting at its absolute best.

players.contribution: 133* off 59 balls - Fastest IPL century in 31 balls

images.caption: AB de Villiers during his fastest IPL century
